title: Bug 17618 - Changing Output Location Doesn't Remove Derived Resources
description: The issue pertains to changing the output location not deleting derived resources as expected.
OB:
When performing the following steps:
1) Create a project (with autobuild enabled).
2) Import Java sources and resources.
3) Change the output folder to project/bin (all class files are removed, which is expected).
4) Change the output folder back to the project (again, all class files are removed as expected).
5) Open the project/bin folder, and all resources are still present. Note: When opening the properties dialog on such a resource, it is tagged as 'Derived'.
EB: The expected behavior is that when the output location is changed, all derived resources should be deleted automatically.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1) Create a project with autobuild enabled.
2) Import Java sources and resources.
3) Change the output folder to project/bin (all class files should be removed).
4) Change the output folder back to the project (all class files should be removed).
5) Open the project/bin folder, and observe that all resources are still there, tagged as 'Derived'.
